DataElement.preferredName: Patient Tooth Gingiva Health Assessment Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the scale related to the assessment of a patient's/participant's health of the teeth and the mucous membrane-covered tissue of the jaws that surrounds the bases of the teeth.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of a patient's/participant's health of the teeth and the mucous membrane-covered tissue of the jaws that surrounds the bases of the teeth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.:The mucous membrane-covered tissue of the jaws that surrounds the bases of the teeth.:The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.
The soft tissue surrounding the neck of individual teeth as well as covering the alveolar bone. The tissue is fibrous and continuous with the periodontal ligament and mucosal covering.

Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a condition or state at a particular time of the patient's tooth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Conforming to the highest quality or standard.

Concepts.definition: Conforming to the highest quality or standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Valuable or useful or agreeable or pleasing._The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems.

Concepts.definition: Valuable or useful or agreeable or pleasing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has a high degree of quality, value or worth.
